page.title: 17Coombe Abbey near Brinklow
page.content: Coombe Abbey built by the Cistercian Monks in 1150 was one of the most important monastic houses in the land. After the dissolution in 1539 it passed to the Crown,was leased to various farming families and in 1581 passed to the Harrington family,under whose care Princess Elizabeth Stuart lived for 5 years.In 1622 the Abbey was sold to the Craven family where it remained until 1922.After various owners, the Abbey was bought by Coventry City Council and is now used for mediaeval banquets.The grounds are used for many events:vintage cars, archery,craft fairs,flower shows and folk festivals.The Abbey employs 18 people,5 live in the park,the rest travel from Coventry.About 250,000 visitors enjoy the Abbey and it is hoped to develop the house and gardens further and improve access to them.
